title: Jamal's economic loss from startup is $14,000

content.description: Jamal quits a job that was paying him <math alttext="$30,000" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>30</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> per year and decides to start his own business. He runs his business out of his house in a room he had been renting to his colleague for <math alttext="$12,000" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>12</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> a year. Jamal withdraws the <math alttext="$20,000" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mi>$</mi> <mn>20</mn> <mtext>,</mtext> <mn>000</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> in his savings account that had been earning him a <math alttext="10" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> percent annual interest to purchase computers and related accessories and equipment for the business. During the first year of operation, Jamal’s business incurred <math alttext="$30,000" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>30</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> in explicit costs and generated <math alttext="$60,000" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>60</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> in total sales.
content.question: Jamal’s economic profit is

unit.text: 3: Production, Cost, and the Perfect Competition Model

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an economic concept, principle, or model using quantitative data or calculations.
